author: o_ohi
body:
I made +65% and +91% on those shitty crm calls monday by 3:10 EST. Bought them between 9AM-11AM. [such a flop](https://i.ibb.co/Wtc5zZ5/418-C6375-F331-4-A64-B835-3-F9937-CDCACA.png) 

In the past three weeks retard bot selected positions that unanimously held 100%+ weekly profit without selling, but that's not what it's designed to do. It's called Retard Bot not genius bot, it follows momentum and quality, but you bought on Tuesday when I posted and by that time the market was in free fall. **You bought calls during a market crash dipshit.**

But its ok. In the future, if the bot continues strong results, I'll publish a website / app so all you 🌈🐻dipshits can see the retard's trades live instead of a day or hour later when I make my post

author: SullyBrr
body:
Salesforce isn’t the type of platform people had to jump to once moving to WFH. It doesn’t really work like that. That shit requires an entire build out (dev project) and your entire business process would have to change after massive amount of testing and training. It’s not the same type of revenue as “oh shit we need a bunch of video conferencing licenses all of a sudden.” If that makes sense. 

Also as a side note: it’s a god fucking awful system to work with imho.

author: DANNYBOYLOVER
body:
\#1 Upselling free users.  One example of a conversion: After a certain amount of survey responses you need a premium account.  Turning even one or two percent free users to paid users would increase revenue by close to 32%.  Survey usage has been up significantly over the past several weeks and is reflected in google analytic searches.

\#2 Scaling their enterprise solutions.  This is the biggest opportunity for $$ them.  Their biggest challenge in Q4 2019 was to show that their enterprise business was scaleable and that people would actually integrate it with their current CRM systems.  And they did.  It increased 121% YoY.  The only reason I can see for them to be where theyre at currently is bceause of the COVID-19 crisis.

THey are much easier to use and more intuitive than their competitors like, Qualtrics for example.

author: shuttdown700
body:
To be fair, V and MA are tech stocks. They do financial services and don’t issue credit. They are just financial tech stocks. 

Also, you have to think what’s gonna be big in the next five years. Cloud computing (AMZN, MSFT, GOOG, ADBE, and NVDA for hardware), enterprise tech platforms (MSFT, CRM, GOOG, ADBE, even AAPL and FB), video games (EA, ATVI, MSFT, NVDA, and FB has oculus)... I can continue but you get it. 

Tech has a lower cost for growth and the lowest entry threshold for obtaining economies of scale than physical retailers or businesses with complex supply chains.
